newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Jakarta call money traded at 10.0/11.0 percent.
newsitem.headline: Jakarta call money traded at 10.0/11.0 percent.

text.p: Jakarta call money was traded at 10.0/11.0 percent on Wednesday morning on sufficient liquidity supply, dealers said.
They said liquidity was slightly tight in early trade before easing as Indonesia's central bank drained some 52 billion rupiah temporarily from the money market.
One local bank dealer said liquidity could tighten later in the day as some companies were likely to withdraw money from banks for monthly expenditure.

The central bank kept its bilateral rates unchanged. The bank offered one-week bilateral SBIs at 6.5 percent, two-week at 8.25, one-month at 10.25, three-month at 10.75, six-month at 11.5 and one-year at 12.0 percent.
The average overnight interbank rate on Tuesday was 8.55 percent. -- Jakarta newsroom +6221 384-6364
